channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Opportunities in the Evolving Cannabis Consumption Market
item.description: For investors in the space, the changing cannabis consumption landscape opens challenges and opportunities in product creation, marketing, and targeting new consumer groups.

item.title: Rich people are going to Walmart more—and they’re a key reason for the company’s recent success
item.description: CEO Doug McMillon told analysts upper-income shoppers account for most of Walmart’s sales gains.

item.title: Vance says media acted like Biden was 'Einstein,' aim to make Harris into 'second coming of Abraham Lincoln'
item.description: Republican vice presidential nominee JD Vance accused the media on Thursday of pretending President Biden is "Albert Einstein" and Vice President Kamala Harris is "the second coming of Abraham Lincoln."

item.title: Vance OKs Oct. 1 debate with Walz, wants more
item.description: Sen. J.D. Vance has agreed to debate Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz on CBS News on Oct. 1 as the two try to make their mark as their parties' vice presidential nominees.

item.title: Tim Walz Is a Radical Leftist
item.description: The Minnesota governor’s ‘aw shucks’ demeanor can’t hide the fact that he abandoned his city to riots and walked out on his battalion before it deployed.

item.title: Biden’s Land Grab Crusade Thwarts Bipartisan Efforts To Develop Housing On Federal Land
item.description: Lawmakers have set their sights on a long-time solution to a nationwide housing shortage: federal land.

item.title: From Sandpiles to Angel Investments
item.description: The presence of power law returns in angel investing, with the potential for significant contributions from a handful of investments, has implications for portfolio construction, investment strategies, and diversification.

item.title: Fellow Gen Xers: That retirement crisis you’re losing sleep over is a ‘rewirement’ opportunity
item.description: Rather than retire after corporate life, Anne Chow decided to “rewire,” completely reimagining her life’s next chapter.

item.title: Trump flips script on Harris' 'duck and hide' media strategy with second press conference in a week
item.description: Aiming to put pressure on Vice President Harris to hold a news conference and sit for an interview, former President Trump on Thursday holds his second news conference in a week

item.title: Radio station threatens to sue Harris' campaign over fake headlines
item.description: A local radio station in North Dakota says it's considering legal action after Vice President Kamala Harris' presidential campaign altered its headlines in campaign ads to make it look as if the news outlet backed her candidacy.

item.title: Injecting Politics into Vaccines
item.description: Political interference in scientific agencies, however benign the motivation, undermines public confidence in health policies.

item.title: Thousands Of Noncitizens On U.S. Voter Rolls Assure Americans The Next Election Will Be Unsafe And Unfair
item.description: Even as conservatives push for election integrity, Democrats deny that noncitizens vote while seeking to expand voting rights to noncitizens.

item.title: Book Review: Pause to Think
item.description: This book is direct, delightful, and articulate in suggesting that we take a slow rather than fast approach to getting things thoughtfully done. It touches the minds and hearts of investment professionals.

item.title: What is ketamine? Potential dangers of the drug responsible for ‘Friends’ star Matthew Perry’s death
item.description: Ketamine, popularly known as the party drug Special K, has recently been hailed as a breakthrough treatment for major depression, but it's not without risks.

item.title: 'Pregnant persons': Ohio Sen Sherrod Brown scrubbed 'women' from bill on pregnancy
item.description: Sen. Brown erased women from his most recent version of a bill relating to health insurance enrollment periods for pregnant women.

item.title: Biden says Medicare drug-price talks will save taxpayers $6 billion in first year
item.description: The Biden administration on Thursday estimated that taxpayers will save $6 billion in the first year of its Medicare drug-price negotiation program.

item.title: Degas and Impressionism: A Thorny Artist Makes for a Quirky Show
item.description: For Impressionism’s 150th anniversary, the Clark Art Institute probes an outsized artist’s cryptic impact.

item.title: Watchdog Raises Ethics Concerns Over National Parks Director Collecting Honorary Degree
item.description: The director of the National Park Service was awarded an honorary degree from a university the agency is working with.

item.title: Is Illiquidity a Blessing in Disguise for Some Investors?
item.description: Rather than running away from illiquidity, investment professionals, investors, and regulators alike should recognize its potential benefits and consider a more balanced approach.

item.title: Goldman Sachs’ CEO was rejected twice by the firm. He’s since led it to over $50 billion in revenue
item.description: You’re less likely to get hired at Goldman Sachs than accepted into Harvard.

item.title: 'Election interference': Trump lawyers call for delayed sentencing in Bragg case
item.description: Lawyers for former President Trump are requesting his sentencing hearing in New York v. Trump be postponed until after the November presidential election.

item.title: Democrats trust Harris slightly more than Biden on climate change, an AP-NORC poll finds
item.description: As the Democratic National Convention approaches, a poll from The Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research finds that Democrats have slightly higher trust in Vice President Kamala Harris' ability to address the issue of climate change than President Joe Biden.

item.title: Big Pharma Is about to Make a Lot of Money, and That’s Good
item.description: Even though drug companies make products that better our lives, they’re subject to right-wing conspiracy theories and left-wing economic jealousy.

item.title: Dems Lay Groundwork To Prosecute, Sue, And Threaten Swing-State Officials Into Certifying Elections
item.description: Wielding prosecutions and threats of lawsuits, Democrats' message is clear: rubber-stamp election results or else.

item.title: Scenario Planning, Foresight, and the Power of Imagination: Navigating an Uncertain Future
item.description: By fostering resilience through the consideration of various outcomes, investment practitioners can better anticipate and manage the complexities and disruptions that characterize today's dynamic environment.

item.title: Toxic metals found in tampons have set off alarm bells—the kind I responded to 35 years ago when starting my company
item.description: Regulators should demand greater transparency in period care products, says Natracare founder and CEO Susie Hewson.

item.title: Harris does about-face on several far-left policies, distances herself from Biden
item.description: Kamala Harris flip-flopped on at least five liberal policy stances on mandatory assault rifle buybacks, fracking, immigration, health care and job guarantees.

item.title: White House says deals struck to cut prices of popular Medicare drugs that cost $50 billion yearly
item.description: The Biden administration is taking a victory lap after federal officials inked deals with drug companies to lower the price for 10 of Medicare's most popular and costliest drugs, but shared few immediate details about the new price older Americans will pay when they fill those prescriptions.

item.title: Sorry, Secretary Cardona, but Rule by Experts Is Not Democracy in Education
item.description: Overzealous defenders of the public-education establishment have lamented the increasing pushback from the political center and right. They’re wrong to do so.

item.title: Is AI Jesus A Helpful Tool Or A Digital Antichrist?
item.description: With the rise of deepfakes and biased AI, there’s never been a more ominous time for Christians to merge their theology with technology.
